intro: Galium sungpanense, commonly known as the Sungpan bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Galium sungpanense is often found in areas with well-drained soil and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
